dict.acceptation: 疼痛的；使人伤心的；恼火的，发怒的；

sent.orig: Sore at Humboldt? He's too fantastic to be sore at.
sent.trans: 生洪堡的气？他疯疯颠颠的，犯不着跟他生气。

sent.orig: But you can't get sore at him. It's like getting sore at God.
sent.trans: 但是，我可不能生他的气，生他的气就像生上帝的气一样。

sent.orig: He stretched his sore limbs after sitting for a long time.
sent.trans: 做了很久之后他伸展一下酸痛的手脚。

sent.orig: There may be only one canker sore or several and they often return.
sent.trans: 常常只有一个或几个溃疡处，而且经常复发。

sent.orig: European bellflower with blue-purple to lilac flowers formerly used to treat sore throat.
sent.trans: 有蓝紫色至丁香紫色花的欧洲风铃草，以前用于治疗喉咙痛。
